value.title: Cobalt Robotics
value.excerpt: At Cobalt Robotics, we build service robots that are maximally helpful for the better of everyone and creates safer, more secure and productive work environments starting with physical security and facilities management. Our unique Robots-as-a-Service (RaaS) model and human-in-the-loop approach create more effective operations at a fraction of the cost of traditional solutions. Organizations in every industry can benefit from Cobalt‚Äôs end-to-end service, which manages everything from hardware and software to people and onboarding.

The world‚Äôs largest banks, payment providers and retailers use Feedzai‚Äôs machine learning technology to manage risks associated with banking and shopping, whether it‚Äôs in person, online or via mobile devices.

value.title: OrCam Technologies
value.excerpt: OrCam harnesses the power of artificial vision to assist people who are visually impaired. OrCam has created a technologically advanced device unique in its ability to provide visual aid through a discreet wearable platform and simple easy-to-use interface which serves to enhance the daily lives of people with vision loss. OrCam gives independence.

value.title: Wave Computing
value.excerpt: Wave Computing is a VC-backed company that is revolutionizing artificial intelligence. with its dataflow-based chips, systems and software that deliver orders of magnitude performance improvements over legacy architectures. The company‚Äôs vision is to bring deep learning to customers‚Äô data wherever it may be‚Äîfrom the edge to the data center‚Äîhelping accelerate time-to-insight. Based in Campbell, CA, Wave Computing has been named Frost & Sullivan‚Äôs 2018 ‚ÄúMachine Learning Industry Technology Innovation Leader,‚Äù and recognized by CIO Application Magazine‚Äôs as one of the ‚ÄúTop 25 Artificial Intelligence Providers.‚Äù Combined with MIPS, Wave now has over 400 granted and pending patents and hundreds of customers worldwide.

value.title: Alitheon
value.excerpt: Alitheon, a leader in advanced machine vision, has created FeaturePrint ‚Äì a system that that securely links the physical and digital worlds. The patented FeaturePrint technology uses artificial intelligence and off the shelf cameras to register and subsequently identify even visually indistinguishable objects with statistical certainty.  This novel capability delivers supply chain intelligence and ensures product authenticity, for producers of industrial parts, pharmaceuticals, semiconductors, additive manufactured parts, precious metals, documents, and luxury goods and other high value assets.

value.title: ArtiQ
value.excerpt: ArtiQ is a young, dynamic and innovative spin-off company of the University of Leuven (Belgium). Company is founded in early 2019 by four committed founders with a long history in respiratory medicine, medical devices and artificial intelligence. Working on a junction of multidisciplinary fields, founders identified opportunity and value that novel technologies could bring to all parties in a respiratory setting: patients, doctors, healthcare system and industry.
